Description: Almond-shaped artificial eye in poor state of preservation, now consisting of at least four fragments with external surface layer of the object partly missing. Faint traces of black pigments seem to be visible. Material it is made of is not identified (dark core with lighter layer on the surface; perhaps faience or clay?). Thick layer of black resinous substance at the back with clear textile impression. The eye would have originally been placed on the orbit of a mummified individual.
Curator's comments: It is possible that artificial eyes EA 90808 and EA 90809 origianlly formed a pair. Published in: P.H.K. Gray, 'Artificial eyes in mummies', JEA 57 (1971) , pl. XXXIV (3rd row, first from the left of fig. 1)
